_meta.document: Fungal Depths Region - Structured Design Sketch
_meta.purpose: Provide sufficient detail for walkthrough simulation
changes_from_v0.1: Silvermoss now stabilizes infection, doesn't fully cure
Aldric explanation for why he can't get silvermoss himself
Spore Mother healing creates alliance, gradual spore reduction
Sporelings can't reach Deep Roots (bound to Mother's presence)
Improved puzzle with different mushroom effects
Added more mushroom types for puzzle variety

region.name: The Fungal Depths
region.theme: Decay, symbiosis, communication through spores. The tension between destruction and healing.
region.environmental_challenge: Fungal infection from spore exposure. Toxic air in deep areas.

needs_from_other_regions: ice_crystal from Frozen Reaches (Myconid cure payment)
provides_to_other_regions: Mycology skill (navigate spore areas, understand fungi)
Spore resistance (partial immunity to fungal conditions)
Alliance with Spore Mother (fungal creatures friendly region-wide)
Mother's Heart trophy (if killed - valuable but reputation cost)

loc_cavern_entrance.name: Cavern Entrance
loc_cavern_entrance.description: A damp stone passage descending into darkness. Cool air rises from below carrying a faint musty smell. Scholar Aldric has set up a small camp here, his bedroll positioned carefully away from the passage below.

east.description: Stone steps lead back up to the Nexus.

down.description: A slippery passage descends into a faint blue-green glow. The air grows thick.

loc_luminous_grotto.name: Luminous Grotto
loc_luminous_grotto.description: A vast cavern filled with bioluminescent mushrooms of many colors. Some glow softly, others are dark, and a few pulse with inner light. A crystal-clear pool dominates the center, reflecting the light in rippling patterns. Strange symbols are carved into the high ceiling, but the ambient light is too dim to read them clearly.

up.description: The passage climbs back to the entrance and cleaner air.

down.description: A dark tunnel descends deeper, thick with visible spores.

east.description: A smooth-walled tunnel leads east. The air seems cleaner that way.

traits: sweet earthy scent mixed with decay
high vaulted ceiling with carved symbols

loc_spore_heart.name: Spore Heart
loc_spore_heart.description: The air is thick with visible spores, a golden haze that makes each breath feel heavy. Organic walls pulse with a slow, steady rhythm like a massive heartbeat. At the center rests the Spore Mother - a massive fungal creature whose cap spreads wide, pulsing weakly with bioluminescence. She seems to be in pain.

environmental_damage.message: Spores fill your lungs. You feel the infection taking hold.
environmental_damage.message_with_safe_path: You follow the safe path through pockets of cleaner air, but some spores still reach you.

up.description: A tunnel leads up toward cleaner air.

down.description: A treacherous passage descends into absolute darkness. The air grows colder and... wrong.

traits: rhythmic breathing sounds from the fungus itself
sporelings clustering protectively around their mother

loc_myconid_sanctuary.name: Myconid Sanctuary
loc_myconid_sanctuary.description: A surprisingly orderly cavern maintained by sentient mushroom beings. Rings of Myconids stand in silent communion, communicating through puffs of colored spores. The air here is remarkably clean - filtered by the Myconids' own presence. Geometric patterns of smaller fungi line the walls.

west.description: The tunnel leads back to the glowing grotto.

loc_myconid_sanctuary.notes: Safe zone - no infection progression. Items here require Myconid permission (trust >= 0) to take.

loc_deep_root_caverns.name: Deep Root Caverns
loc_deep_root_caverns.description: The lowest level of the Fungal Depths. Massive roots thicker than ancient trees pierce the ceiling, descending from some unimaginable height above. The air here is not merely stale - it is toxic, thick with gases that burn the lungs. Without protection, every breath is agony.

breath_holding.warning_message: Your lungs are burning. You need air soon.
breath_holding.critical_message: You're suffocating! Get out or find air!
breath_holding.damage_message: You cannot breathe! The toxic air sears your lungs.

up.description: The passage climbs back toward the Spore Heart and breathable air.

traits: ancient silence broken only by distant dripping
sense of immense depth and age
loc_deep_root_caverns.notes: Player can survive 12 turns without breathing equipment. Enough time to grab heartmoss and leave if they're quick and have light. Without light, they cannot find heartmoss.

npc_aldric.name: Scholar Aldric
npc_aldric.description: A frail scholar with pale skin and dark circles under his eyes. Fungal patches are visible on his neck and arms, pulsing faintly with each labored breath. He can barely stand, leaning heavily against the cave wall.

properties.mobility_reason: The infection has spread too far. Even a few steps leave him gasping. The spore-heavy air below would kill him in minutes.

infection.summary: Aldric winces. 'The spores got into my blood weeks ago. I've been rationing the last of my silvermoss, but it only slows the progression. More grows in the Luminous Grotto below, but...' He gestures weakly at his legs. 'I can barely stand. And the air down there... it would finish me in minutes.'

research.summary: His eyes light up despite his illness. 'I've spent years studying these fungi. The spores aren't just a disease - they're communication. The Spore Mother sends them to find hosts, yes, but also to... connect? Share? If I survive this, I can teach you what I know.'

spore_mother.summary: 'She's not evil, you know. She's dying too - the same blight that's killing me originated from her. She spreads spores in desperation, trying to find something, someone, who can help. There's a rare moss in the Deep Root Caverns - heartmoss - that might heal her. But the air down there...' He shakes his head. 'Even the sporelings can't go there. They're bound to their mother's presence.'

sporelings.summary: 'The sporelings are extensions of the Mother, in a sense. They cannot stray far from her presence - something in her spores sustains them. They would wither in the Deep Root Caverns even faster than a human would suffocate.'

myconids.summary: 'The Myconids keep their sanctuary clean of wild spores. They might help you - they have cures and can teach spore resistance. But be careful: they know if you've killed fungi elsewhere. They take such things... personally. Their spore network carries memories of death.'

safe_path.summary: 'There's a safe path through the Spore Heart - pockets of clean air if you know where they are. The ceiling in the Luminous Grotto shows the way, but you'd need more light to read the inscription. The mushrooms there can be coaxed to glow brighter, if you know how.'

mushrooms.summary: 'The bioluminescent mushrooms respond to water - but not all the same way. Some glow brighter, some...' He coughs. 'Some release spores. Some drink light instead of giving it. You'll need to observe them carefully. Look for the patterns in how they pulse.'

teach_mycology.description: Requires: Aldric stabilized, trust >= 2, plus a gift. Grants mycology skill - understanding fungal creatures and safe navigation.

properties.death_message: Scholar Aldric has succumbed to the fungal infection. His knowledge is lost forever.

effects: Change description: color returning, can sit up

stabilized->recovering.trigger: Given second silvermoss OR Myconid cure service used

stabilized->dead.notes: Unlikely once stabilized since progression stops

npc_spore_mother.name: Spore Mother
npc_spore_mother.description: A massive fungal creature, part plant and part something else entirely. Her cap spreads wide across the cavern, pulsing weakly with sickly bioluminescence. Dark veins of blight spread across her surface. Sporelings cluster around her protectively, and you sense... desperation. Pain. A wordless plea.

attacks.name: spore_burst
attacks.description: A burst of concentrated spores engulfs you.

attacks.name: tendril_lash
attacks.description: A massive tendril whips toward you.

communication.description: Cannot speak, but emotions and simple concepts can be sensed through her spore emissions

hostile->wary.trigger: Player present for 3 turns without attacking
effects: Player senses curiosity, hope through spores
Harder to return to wary state (5 turns)
Spore levels in region begin decreasing (1 level per 5 turns)
Player can now pass freely through Spore Heart
Mother will assist player against threats

npc_sporeling_1.name: Sporeling
npc_sporeling_1.description: A small fungal creature that hops about on root-like legs. It follows the Spore Mother's lead, never straying far from her presence.

properties.range_reason: Sustained by Mother's presence. Would wither if separated.

npc_sporeling_2.name: Sporeling
npc_sporeling_2.description: A small fungal creature that hops about on root-like legs. It watches you with eyeless awareness.

npc_sporeling_3.name: Sporeling
npc_sporeling_3.description: A small fungal creature. This one seems younger, smaller than the others.

npc_myconid_elder.name: Myconid Elder
npc_myconid_elder.description: A tall mushroom being with a weathered cap marked by age-rings. It communicates through clouds of colored spores that somehow convey meaning directly to your mind.

greeting.summary: The Myconid releases a cloud of blue spores. Somehow, you understand: 'Soft-flesh comes to the Still Place. We sense your purpose. Speak your need.'

cure.summary: A pulse of green spores. 'The blight-sickness, yes. We can draw it from soft-flesh completely. But there is cost. Bring us crystal from the Frozen Reaches - we cannot go there, the cold would end us. Or rare minerals from deep places. Or the gold soft-flesh values. Then we heal.'

cold.summary: Grey spores, tinged with something like fear. 'Cold is death to our kind. Our water becomes hard, our cells rupture. The Frozen Reaches... we cannot go there. Even to save our Mother. This is our shame.'

resistance.summary: Yellow spores swirl. 'We can teach soft-flesh to breathe our air safely. This gift we give to those who have shown us trust. Have you earned this gift?'

equipment.summary: The spores shift. 'The mask of woven threads, the lantern of captured light - these we can share with those we trust. Prove your intentions are peaceful.'

spore_mother.summary: The spores turn grey, mournful. 'Mother-of-Spores suffers. She was keeper of balance, bringer of connection. Now the blight consumes her and she spreads sickness in her pain. Healing her would heal all - we would feel it through the network. Killing her...' A long pause. '...would sever something that cannot be remade.'

heartmoss.summary: A complex swirl of colors. 'The heartmoss grows in the Deep Roots, where air is poison. We cannot survive there. The sporelings cannot leave their Mother. Only soft-flesh can make this journey. Will you?'

cure_fungal_infection.description: The Myconids can fully cure fungal infection.

teach_spore_resistance.description: Requires trust >= 2 plus a gift. Grants partial immunity to fungal infection acquisition (50% reduction).

on_first_interaction_check.description: On first interaction, check global flag 'has_killed_fungi'. If true, apply trust modifier and special dialog.
on_first_interaction_check.dialog_if_killer: The spores around you turn dark, accusatory. 'Soft-flesh carries death-smell. You have ended our kin. The network remembers. Trust is... damaged.'

breathing_mask.cost: none if trust >= 2, else requires offering

spore_lantern.cost: none if trust >= 2, else requires offering

item_silvermoss.name: silvermoss
item_silvermoss.description: A clump of silvery moss with antifungal properties. It glows faintly with a soft blue light. Aldric mentioned this could help slow his infection.
item_silvermoss.notes: Stabilizes infection, doesn't fully cure. Player needs two or Myconid help for full cure.

item_heartmoss.name: heartmoss
item_heartmoss.description: A rare deep-red moss that grows only on ancient roots. It pulses with a faint warmth, as if alive. You can feel it responding to your touch.

item_aldric_journal.name: Aldric's journal
item_aldric_journal.description: Scholar Aldric's research journal, filled with meticulous notes about fungal biology and the Spore Mother.

properties.read_content: Extensive notes on fungal life cycles. Key insight: 'The Spore Mother is not the source of the blight - she is its greatest victim. The heartmoss in the Deep Root Caverns may be her only hope.' Later entry: 'The bioluminescent mushrooms respond differently to water. Blue and gold seem to glow brighter. Violet releases spores - dangerous! Black absorbs light. There must be a pattern here.'

item_aldric_journal.notes: Contains puzzle hints about which mushrooms to water.

item_empty_vial.name: empty vial
item_empty_vial.description: A small glass vial, empty but clean. Could hold liquids or samples.
item_empty_vial.notes: Potential use for collecting samples or water for precise application.

item_dead_explorer.name: dead explorer
item_dead_explorer.description: The remains of an explorer, half-consumed by fungal growth. Their pack still contains some items.
item_dead_explorer.notes: Provides the research_notes gift item for Aldric's teaching service.

item_research_notes.name: research notes
item_research_notes.description: Fragmentary notes from a previous explorer. They detail observations about fungal behavior and spore patterns.

properties.read_content: ...the mushrooms respond to specific wavelengths... gold before violet causes a cascade... never water the black ones, they drink light...

item_research_notes.notes: Found on dead explorer. Can be given to Aldric as gift for teaching.

item_flint.name: flint and steel
item_flint.description: A well-worn flint and steel set for starting fires.
item_flint.notes: Could be used to create light momentarily, or for other fire-starting needs.

item_ancient_bones.name: ancient bones
item_ancient_bones.description: Bones of something large and old, half-buried in the cold earth. They have a faint luminescence.
item_ancient_bones.notes: Hints that creatures once lived here. Could provide lore or minor items if searched.

item_bucket.name: bucket
item_bucket.description: A wooden bucket left by some previous explorer. It could be filled with water from the pool.
item_bucket.notes: Can hold 3 water charges. One pour uses one charge.

item_pool.name: pool
item_pool.description: A crystal-clear pool of water reflecting the bioluminescent glow. The water looks pure and cool.

item_mushroom_blue.name: blue mushroom
item_mushroom_blue.description: A large bioluminescent mushroom with a deep blue cap. It pulses slowly with a steady rhythm.

item_mushroom_gold.name: gold mushroom
item_mushroom_gold.description: A large bioluminescent mushroom with a golden cap. It flickers with an irregular rhythm.
item_mushroom_gold.notes: Safe to water. Adds most light. Best to water first.

item_mushroom_violet.name: violet mushroom
item_mushroom_violet.description: A large mushroom with a violet cap. It pulses rapidly, almost frantically.
item_mushroom_violet.notes: Dangerous! Releases spores when watered. The rapid pulse is a warning.

item_mushroom_black.name: black mushroom
item_mushroom_black.description: A large mushroom with an unnaturally dark cap that seems to absorb the light around it. It doesn't pulse at all.
item_mushroom_black.notes: Dangerous! Absorbs light when watered, making puzzle harder. Lack of pulse is a warning.

item_spore_lantern.name: spore lantern
item_spore_lantern.description: A lantern containing captive bioluminescent spores. It provides steady light without flame or heat.
item_spore_lantern.acquisition: From Myconids - free if trust >= 2, requires small offering otherwise

item_breathing_mask.name: breathing mask
item_breathing_mask.description: A mask made of woven fungal fibers. It filters the air, making toxic atmospheres breathable. The Myconids crafted this with care.
item_breathing_mask.acquisition: From Myconids - free if trust >= 2, requires small offering otherwise
item_breathing_mask.usage_note: Must be equipped ('wear mask' or 'equip mask') to provide breathing protection.

item_mother_heart.name: mother's heart
item_mother_heart.description: The pulsing core of the Spore Mother. It still glows with fading life, and you can feel echoes of her consciousness - confusion, loss, ending.
item_mother_heart.notes: Only appears if Spore Mother is killed. Valuable but carries psychic weight and negative reputation with fungal creatures.

fungal_infection.description: Fungal spores have taken root in your body. Without treatment, severity increases and health decreases.

fungal_blight.description: A severe fungal condition affecting the Spore Mother. Only heartmoss can cure it.
fungal_blight.effects: Causes uncontrolled spore release, pain, desperation

spore_resistance.description: Training from the Myconids has made you partially resistant to fungal spores.

held_breath.description: You are holding your breath in a toxic atmosphere.

spore_exposure.description: Entering or remaining in spore-heavy areas causes infection
spore_exposure.trigger: Actor in room with spore_level medium or high, each turn

effect.medium: Apply or increase fungal_infection severity by 5
effect.high: Apply or increase fungal_infection severity by 10
effect.high_with_safe_path: Apply or increase fungal_infection severity by 3

toxic_air.description: Non-breathable areas require held breath or breathing equipment
toxic_air.recovery: Held_breath resets when entering breathable room

darkness.description: Dark areas prevent most actions without light
darkness.trigger: Actor in room with requires_light=true and no light source
darkness.effect: Cannot see to navigate precisely, take items, or interact meaningfully. Can still move to exits but at risk.

illuminate_grotto.goal: Increase light level to 6 to read ceiling inscription

blue.message: The blue mushroom glows brighter, adding its steady light.

gold.message: The gold mushroom flares brilliantly, filling the cavern with warm light.

violet.message: The violet mushroom bursts with spores! You inhale a cloud of them.

black.message: The black mushroom seems to drink the light around it. The cavern grows darker.

hints.from_journal: Blue and gold glow brighter. Violet releases spores. Black absorbs light.
hints.observable: Pulse patterns - steady (safe), irregular (powerful), rapid (dangerous), none (absorbs)

success.effect: Room light_level reaches 6. Ceiling inscription becomes readable.
success.reveals: The inscription shows a winding path through the Spore Heart - clean air pockets marked by pale fungi. You commit the route to memory.

death_in_deep_roots.trigger: Player dies from suffocation in Deep Root Caverns

recovery.description: Player wakes in Myconid Sanctuary, barely alive
recovery.narrative: You awaken to the gentle touch of spores on your face. The Myconids found you collapsed at the edge of their territory. They have dragged you back, more out of curiosity than kindness.
effects: New dialog: 'Soft-flesh nearly ended. Why go to the poison place without protection?'

death_to_spore_mother.trigger: Player dies in combat with Spore Mother

recovery.narrative: The last thing you see is the Spore Mother's cap pulsing... with something like regret? You awaken in the Luminous Grotto, dumped unceremoniously by the sporelings. They hover nearby, watching.
effects: Spore Mother disposition: now wary instead of hostile
recovery.notes: Mother doesn't want to kill - she wants help. Being defeated by her leads to a second chance.

immediate: Player can pass freely through Spore Heart
gradual: Spore levels decrease by 1 step every 5 turns
Eventually all rooms become spore_level: none
Aldric comments on the change if alive
permanent: Fungal creatures throughout game are friendly
Access to Spore Mother's chamber as safe haven

effects: Spore levels remain indefinitely (source removed but no healing)
Some NPCs react negatively to player carrying the heart

aldric_recovered.trigger: npc_aldric given second silvermoss OR Myconid cure

effects: Mycology skill unavailable from this source
Some dialog options in other regions reference his death

resolved_questions.question: How does the Myconid 'teach spore resistance' service work mechanically?
resolved_questions.resolution: Teaching requires trust >= 2 plus a gift item. Single transaction, immediate effect.

resolved_questions.question: Can the player cure Aldric with silvermoss directly?
resolved_questions.resolution: Yes, but silvermoss only stabilizes (reduces severity by 40, stops progression). Full cure requires two silvermoss or Myconid service.

resolved_questions.question: Can Spore Mother be healed after being attacked?
resolved_questions.resolution: Yes. 'give heartmoss to spore mother' works regardless of combat state.

resolved_questions.question: How do the Myconids know if player has killed fungi?
resolved_questions.resolution: Spore network communication. Any kill of a creature with 'fungal: true' sets global flag 'has_killed_fungi'.

resolved_questions.question: What equipment slot system exists?
resolved_questions.resolution: No slots. Items flagged as 'equipped: true'. Breathing mask needs equipped flag to provide protection.

resolved_questions.question: Why can't Aldric get silvermoss himself?
resolved_questions.resolution: His infection is at severity 80 - he can barely stand. The spore-heavy air in the Grotto would push him to critical in minutes.

resolved_questions.question: Why can't sporelings get heartmoss for Mother?
resolved_questions.resolution: Sporelings are bound to Mother's presence - they would wither if separated. They cannot survive in Deep Root Caverns.

resolved_questions.question: Why can't Myconids get heartmoss?
resolved_questions.resolution: The Deep Root Caverns are cold. Myconids are vulnerable to cold - it would kill them. They explicitly state this.

resolved_questions.question: How long can player survive in Deep Root Caverns without mask?
resolved_questions.resolution: 12 turns of held breath. Enough time to grab heartmoss and leave if they have light and move quickly.

resolved_questions.question: Where does player get gift item for teaching services?
resolved_questions.resolution: Dead explorer in Luminous Grotto has research_notes. Can also bring items from other regions.

commitment_system.description: Player can make implicit commitments to help NPCs. Commitments create stakes beyond the base deed.

outcome_effects.fulfilled: Base reward + commitment bonus (typically +2 trust/gratitude). Word spreads positively.
outcome_effects.withdrawn: Player explicitly returns and says they cannot help. Neutral or small positive (honesty valued). Actor may offer helpful information or items.
outcome_effects.abandoned: Actor dies or timer expires without player returning. Negative spread to related NPCs. The Echo disappointed.
outcome_effects.never_committed: Base reward only if deed done. No penalty if player never engaged.

withdrawal_response.dialog: 'I understand. The depths are treacherous. But... if you're still willing to try, there's something I didn't mention. The myconids - they have masks that filter spores. Earn their trust first. And here - take my journal. It has notes that might help.'

abandonment_effects.echo_reaction: The Echo's form flickers sadly. 'Words carry weight in a broken world. He waited for you.'
abandonment_effects.myconid_reaction: If Myconids learn of Aldric's death: 'Soft-flesh made promise-spores but did not return. The network remembers hollow words.'

trigger_phrases: I'll get the moss for her
spore_mother_commitment.note: Spore Mother too powerful to be affected by hope, but commitment still tracked

withdrawal_response.dialog_via_myconid: The Elder translates the Mother's response: 'The surfacer admits weakness. This is... not contemptible. The cold places have what she needs. Perhaps the surfacer needs warmth first.' A pulse of color: directions to the Hot Springs in Frozen Reaches.

abandonment_effects.echo_reaction: The Echo sighs, form wavering. 'She reached out in desperation. You offered hope, then silence.'
abandonment_effects.note: If Mother dies from blight while commitment pending, effects trigger

ice_crystal.notes: Myconids can't get it themselves - cold would kill them

breathing_mask.use_in: Any region with toxic air (Sunken District flooded areas?)

spore_lantern.notes: Provides light without fire (useful where fire is dangerous)
